snippet: President Obama’s handling of his confrontation with Syria has been an unusual instance of a commander in chief seemingly thinking out loud and changing his mind on the fly.
abstract: Pres Obama’s handling of his confrontation with Syria has been unusual instance of commander in chief seemingly thinking out loud and changing his mind publicly; speech addressing increasing tension over Syria’s use of chemical weapons was assumed by many to be announcement that attack that had been broadly hinted at had begun, but instead he turned decision over to Congress; when president appeared on television weeks later to make speech initially intended to promote force, he instead made argument for diplomacy.
lead_paragraph: President Obama’s handling of his confrontation with Syria has been an unusual instance of a commander in chief seemingly thinking out loud and changing his mind on the fly.

headline.main: A Rare Public View of Obama’s Pivots on Policy in Syria Confrontation
headline.print_headline: A Rare Public View of Obama’s Pivots on Policy Amid a Confrontation
